JOINT SUERTAINTYeet 1-7

11) You are my wife I am. In return for my love and affection for you, I hereby grant you a free and secure income for your well-being in the community. The immovable property mentioned in the third paragraph below has been acquired by me as my father and has been granted to me by the Maharajashri Sabbavaram Mandal Tahsildar in my name. I have been issued with 1B Account No. 596 and L.P.M. No. 337 in the Revenue Record. I have full rights and interests in the said property and no one else has any rights or interests in the said property. As of today, there are no mortgages, charges, gifts, guarantees, seizures, charges, etc. or any other encumbrances or bindings on the said property. I hereby transfer to you the immovable property of the Scheduled Property, having the present market value of Rs. 8,43,000/- in words, free of charge, and you shall develop the Scheduled Property on the full rightful owner thereof and register it in your name in the accounts of the Panchayat Revenue Government and pay the taxes etc. thereof yourself and you shall enjoy it freely and happily with all the full rights of your children, grandchildren, descendants, descendants, loans, donations, sale rights and so on, as you wish. I shall decide on my own responsibility and execute this Settlement Document without any delay in any disputes that may arise regarding this Scheduled Property.

We have examined the details of the EC regarding the same. U/S 22-B(Central Act-
16 of 1908) vide Andhra Pradesh Ordinance No 7 of 2016 dated 03-12-2016 I hereby declare that no one else has any right over the property transferred by this deed, i.e. the property which has come into my possession as my father's property, and that I have not sold or transacted any business with any person or made any other encroachment on the property. I am fully responsible for any discrepancies in the above. I hereby declare that the land transferred by this deed is free from any mango, coconut, betel nut, mango, coconut, mango In case of any misrepresentation of facts, I accept the prosecution and shall be fully liable for payment of deficiency stamp duty under Sections 27 and 64 of the Indian Stamp Act. In the course of preparing this document, we have thoroughly examined and included in this document all the necessary details such as the linked documents, details of the parties, addresses of the parties, photographs of the parties, property details etc. and have prepared the document. No matter that should have been written or included has been left out in this document. The schedule property has been physically inspected and measured and the document has been drawn up. In the future, the property in the said document will not be found to be defective in any way during the inspection conducted by the Registration Stamp Duty Officers. Duty is our full responsibility
and any other matters for the sake of the property.

boundaries.boundaryE: Jirayati mettu land belonging to Gavara Simhachalam Naidu and Karri Bangarayya

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 472 of 2026, dated 30/Jan/2026, executed by Gavara Simhachalam Naidu in favour of his Wife, Gavara Aruna towards the property admeasuring an extent of 140.36 Sq.Yds, comprised in survey number 59-23, situated in Pydivada Village and Grama panchayath, Sabbavaram Mandal, within the District of Anakapalli, registered at sub-registrar office Sabbavaram(309), is bounded as follows: North by: Road South by: Road East by: Jirayati mettu land belonging to Gavara Simhachalam Naidu and Karri Bangarayya West by: Road
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
